abstract: News Analysis; political statements from both sides of debate over nuclear deal with Iran do not fully reflect reality, or complexity, of agreement; Obama administration's inability to describe exactly what it knows about confidential inspection regime planned for Parchin military base near Tehran is fodder for opponents of deal who want to convince world that White House is hiding exactly how agreement would be monitored.
lead_paragraph: A military base in Iran has become a symbol of whether international inspectors are interested in digging into the past, or will just be checking boxes.

headline.main: Prospect of Self-Inspections by Iran Feeds Opposition to Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Critics of Deal Find Fuel in Iran Self-Inspections

snippet: A military base in Iran has become a symbol of whether international inspectors are interested in digging into the past, or will just be checking boxes.
